page.title: 17INDOOR SPORTS
page.content: About 150-200 people attend the local swimming pool, built in 1969 from public contributions and recently renovated. In term time the schools make use of the pool. A,B,and C squads give extra training to young swimmers and an Adult night caters for older non-swimmers. For very young people there's a new playpark with tyres, a sandpit, house etc and decorated walls . The Community Centre gives indoor games and is the home of the youth clubs. However new facilities at the new school at Garson - games room, all weather outdoor courts etc- are taking over from existing ones. A Squash Court is well attended in the winter time. A recently opened Games Room is meant to cater for teenagers. In the hotels, pool and darts are played.
